Posted By: Hentai (1/30/2010 1:02:45 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I second Wolfv's opinion. The only decent Zendikar deck anyone seems able to make is a Vampire deck, and it doesn't even take skill. The only problem with Vampire decks is their trouble dealing with 3/3s and higher once all their kill spells are gone (a deck that gets its face stomped by a Giant Caterpillar is NOT a deck for the ages), but this card breaks even that. Here's hoping we see some serious Vampire-hate cards in Rise of the Eldrazi.
posts.html:
I second Wolfv's opinion. The only decent Zendikar deck anyone seems able to make is a Vampire deck, and it doesn't even take skill. The only problem with Vampire decks is their trouble dealing with 3/3s and higher once all their kill spells are gone (a deck that gets its face stomped by a Giant Caterpillar is NOT a deck for the ages), but this card breaks even that. Here's hoping we see some serious Vampire-hate cards in Rise of the Eldrazi.

Posted By: wolfv (1/29/2010 4:46:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Anyone else think this is at the wrong rarity? I mean it should be ethier costed diffrently and common so everybody and his brother has one whether they playing vamps or not....or maybe even cheaper (one black? how sick would that be?) and rare? This would have been a very intresting card if it were somthing like: rare BBBB destroy target creature and put that many counters on each vampire you control. Already BB says it goes in monoblack decks mostly so why not make it superblack? Its my experiance in sealed at least that uncommons have a tendency to clump, at my rl one the guy sitting next to me pulled three of these and no vamps, and of course I had a ton of common vamps but none of these? Results? Neighbor didnt win much at all and I went 3-2....a horrible result for magic in general. If urge was rare I woulda said so what I didnt pull any I only opend 3 wake packs...but if the general opinion is that vamps need this to go over the top, then they should have made it common.
posts.html:
